metadata.title: CVE-2016-6890 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in MatrixSSL before 3.8.6 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted Subject Alt Name in anX.509 certificate.

criterions.comment: matrixssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
